item.title: BNB Surges Above $885 in Short Term, Continues to Hit New Highs This Year
item.description: On August 23rd, based on HTX market data, BNB experienced a brief surge and rose above $885, reaching a peak of $885.54. Currently, it is trading at $884.04 and continues to set a new high for the year.

item.title: Canada to Lift Retaliatory Tariffs on the U.S., Extending an Olive Branch to Trump
item.description: On August 23rd, Canada is going to lift the retaliatory tariffs on a large number of American products that meet the existing North American Free Trade Agreement. This is intended to ease tensions with the White House. Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney is expected to make this announcement on Friday after a cabinet meeting. According to sources familiar with the matter and requesting anonymity, the government will adjust its tariff policy to be more in line with the United States' measures.This indicates that many American consumer goods will no longer be subject to a 25% tariff when exported to Canada as long as they comply with the terms of the USMCA. However, the Canadian government may keep a 25% import tariff on American steel and aluminum products, as well as tariffs on American automobiles. Former President Trump had imposed tariffs on these industries. (Soochow Securities)

item.title: LINK 24-hour Price Change Reaches 8.82%, Coin Price Hits New Yearly High
item.description: On August 23rd, according to HTX market data, LINK is currently trading at $27.5154. It has witnessed a 24-hour price increase of 8.82% and reached a new annual high.

item.title: Ethereum Surges Past $4700, 24-hour Gain Reaches 11.13%
item.description: On August 23rd, based on HTX market data, Ethereum has exceeded $4700 and is currently trading at $4728, with a 24-hour percentage change of 11.13%.

item.title: Deutsche Bank: Expects the Fed to cut rates by 25 basis points in September and December, previously predicted only a rate cut in December
item.description: On August 22nd, Deutsche Bank anticipates that the Federal Reserve will reduce interest rates by 25 basis points in September and December. Previously, the bank had predicted that the Federal Reserve would only cut interest rates in December 2025.

item.title: Jump Crypto has proposed the DFBA mechanism to address the challenges of traditional CLOBs on the blockchain.
item.description: On August 23rd, the research team of market maker Jump Crypto published an article putting forward a new trading mechanism named Dual Flow Batch Auction (DFBA), with the aim of addressing the challenges faced by traditional Continuous Limit Order Books (CLOBs) on the blockchain.It is reported that CLOBs rely on continuous matching and a time priority mechanism, which gives rise to latency arbitrage, MEV (Miner Extractable Value) issues, and adverse trading liquidity, thereby increasing market trading costs.DFBA conducts two independent auctions every 100 milliseconds. It divides orders into Maker and Taker groups and completes transactions at a single fair settlement price. This mechanism eliminates the time priority, avoids competition among liquidity providers, and shifts the competitive focus from speed to price and scale.Compared to traditional designs, DFBA can provide tighter quotes, deeper liquidity. At the same time, it protects natural traders from the impacts of latency

item.title: SOL Short-Term Breakout Above $195, 24-hour Gain Reaches 7.31%
item.description: On August 22nd, based on HTX market data, SOL experienced a brief surge and rose above $195. Currently, it is trading at $194.86, indicating a 24-hour price increase of 7.31%.

item.title: Bitcoin Short-Term Breaks $117,000, Daily Gain Reaches 3.72%
item.description: On August 22nd, according to HTX market data, Bitcoin briefly rose above $117,000 and is currently trading at $116,989, with a daily increase of 3.72%.

item.title: Viewpoint: It is expected to have a total interest rate cut of 75 basis points by the end of the year
item.description: On August 22nd, Kathy Bostjancic, the chief economist of Nationwide, stated that the Federal Reserve will cut interest rates by a total of 75 basis points before the end of the year. She pointed out, "Powell has adopted a noticeably more dovish tone and significantly opened the door to a rate cut in September. He sees that the downside risks to employment are rising significantly. This supports our view that there will be a 25 basis points rate cut next month. We also continue to expect that by the end of the year, the Fed will have cut rates by a total of 75 basis points because the labor market will further weaken and the rise in inflation is only moderate and temporary." (FXStreet)

item.title: Federal Reserve's Harker: Fed Should Stick to Moderately Constrained Monetary Policy
item.description: On August 22nd, Federal Reserve's Harker expressed that the Fed has not yet attained its inflation target completely and should adhere to a moderately restrained monetary policy. It is necessary to exercise caution before taking any rate-cutting measures. It is anticipated that the inflation and unemployment rates in the United States will rise.
